Heritrix normally respects <base href=3D"...">. I'm guessing it fails in th=
is
case because it's not inside the <head> section. (There is a </head> but=
 no
<head>.)

Noah

On Tue, Jul 3, 2018 at 3:51 AM david.reiner82@...=
 [archive-crawler] <
archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com> wrote:

>
>
> At the =
moment Heritrix (3.3.0 Snapshop) seems to ignore base href tags.
>
> Exampl=
e:
> https://www.schmid-gartenpflanzen.de/forum/index.php/mv/msg/7627/21614=
2/0/
> <base href=3D"/forum/"/>
> <a href=3D"/forum/index.php/fa/89652/0/"
=
> title=3D"IMG_7651kl.jpg">IMG_7651kl.jpg</a>
>
> Web browsers interpret th=
e link this way:
> https://www.schmid-gartenpflanzen.de/forum/index.php/fa/=
89652/0/
>
> However, Heritrix calls this url:
>
> https://www.schmid-garte=
npflanzen.de/forum/index.php/mv/msg/7627/216142/0/index.php/fa/89652/0/
>
>=
 This behaviour leads to thousands of false urls being crawled. From my
> p=
oint of view, the Heritrix behavior is a bug, isn't it?
>
> -David
>
>
> 
>=

At the moment Heritrix (3.3.0 Snapshop) seems to ignore b=
ase href tags. <br><br>Example:<br><a href=3D"https://www.schmid-gartenpfla=
nzen.de/forum/index.php/mv/msg/7627/216142/0/" target=3D"_blank">https://ww=
w.schmid-gartenpflanzen.de/forum/index.php/mv/msg/7627/216142/0/</a><br>&lt=
;base href=3D"/forum/"/><br><a href=3D"/forum/index.ph=
p/fa/89652/0/" title=3D"IMG_7651kl.jpg">IMG_7651kl.jpg&lt=
;/a><br><br>Web browsers interpret the link this way:<br><a href=3D"http=
s://www.schmid-gartenpflanzen.de/forum/index.php/fa/89652/0/" target=3D"_bl=
ank">https://www.schmid-gartenpflanzen.de/forum/index.php/fa/89652/0/</a><b=
r><br>However, Heritrix calls this url:<br><a href=3D"https://www.schmid-ga=
rtenpflanzen.de/forum/index.php/mv/msg/7627/216142/0/index.php/fa/89652/0/"=
 target=3D"_blank">https://www.schmid-gartenpflanzen.de/forum/index.php/mv/=
msg/7627/216142/0/index.php/fa/89652/0/</a><br><br><div>This behaviour lead=
s to thousands of false urls being crawled. From my point of view, the Heri=
trix behavior is a bug, isn't it?</div><div><br></div><div>-David<br></=
div>
